definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

sentences.english: He could not restrain himself from shouting aloud.
sentences.chinese: 他剋制不住自己要大聲喊叫。

sentences.english: Jack calls out to Ellis, but Ellis is dead.
sentences.chinese: 傑克通過電話大聲喊叫着埃利斯，但他已經死翹翹了。

sentences.english: Then she cried aloud, and began to weep.
sentences.chinese: 這時她大聲喊叫，開始哭了起來。

sentences.english: Philoctetes cries out and faints from the extremity of his sufferings.
sentences.chinese: 菲羅克忒忒斯因爲極度的痛苦而大聲喊叫並且暈倒了。

sentences.english: The baby is clamouring to be fed .
sentences.chinese: 這嬰兒大聲喊叫要人來餵飯。

sentences.english: They seemed to shout themselves out and make the atmosphere ring.
sentences.chinese: 每一個字都似乎在大聲喊叫，連空氣都被震得發響。

sentences.english: The woman glared within the man after he shouted rudely at her.
sentences.chinese: 那男人野蠻地衝她大聲喊叫，她也怒目而視。

sentences.english: She likes to bawl against people.
I shouted at her,but she didn't react at all.
sentences.chinese: 我向她大聲喊叫，但她毫無反應。

sentences.english: The woman bangs on her steering wheel, yells louder.
sentences.chinese: 那個女人使勁拍着她的方向盤，大聲喊叫着。

sentences.english: Its not polite to shout at people.
sentences.chinese: 朝人大聲喊叫是不禮貌的。

sentences.english: Shout only as a last resort.
sentences.chinese: 只有最後一次求助時才能大聲喊叫。
福羅拉聽到有人大聲喊叫。

definition: please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to whisper to one another's ear
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
